### üöÄ Describe the new functionality needed

Spawned off from [#2703](https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack/pull/2703)

Currently, vector-io providers do not have a way to configure the embedding model at the provider level.

When creating vector stores, users must manually specify the embedding model or a default is used(first embedding model that appears in run.yaml

The requested functionality is to add embedding model configuration to vector-io provider configurations, allowing users to:

1. Specify a default embedding model in the vector-io provider config
2. Override the default embedding model at vector store creation time if needed

### üí° Why is this needed? What if we don't build it?

e.g.

```
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    provider_type: inline::faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"  # NEW: configurable embedding model
      embedding_dimension: 384              # NEW: configurable dimension
```

> What if we don't build it?

If not specified on vector store creation the embedding model used will be the first model available in run.yaml, which can varies on restart based on environment variables. This can cause confusion to the user and surprising results.

### Other thoughts

Backward compatibility should be maintained - if no embedding model is specified at provider level, fall back to current behaviour

## Quick question about embedding dimensions

Hey team! Working on the configurable embedding models feature and wanted to run something by you.

Right now I'm making users specify both the model AND the dimension in their config:

```
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
      embedding_dimension: 384
```

But honestly, this feels redundant. Since each model has a fixed dimension (all-MiniLM-L6-v2 is always 384), why make users look this up and type it manually?

I'm thinking we should just auto-lookup the dimension from the model registry:

```
# Much cleaner - system figures out it's 384 dimensions
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
```

The dimension field would only be needed for custom models that aren't in our registry.

Does this make sense? Or is there a reason users should explicitly specify dimensions even for known models?

Also - are there any embedding models that have multiple valid dimensions? I can't think of any but wanted to double check before assuming one model = one dimension.

If it makes it optional, I can see the following scenarios.

```
## RECOMMENDED: Auto-lookup dimension
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"  # System finds 384 dimensions automatically

## REQUIRED: Custom model needs explicit dimension
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "my-custom-model"
      embedding_dimension: 768  # Required - not in registry

## OPTIONAL: Explicit validation
vector_io:
  - provider_id: faiss
    config:
      embedding_model: "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
      embedding_dimension: 384  # Validates against registry (384)
```

Hi [@ashwinb](https://github.com/ashwinb) , per my understanding,

If a user omits embedding\_model when creating a vector store, the stack grabs ‚Äúthe first model in run.yaml‚Äù‚Äîthat can change between deployments, so identical API calls embed with different models/dimensions.

Teams must repeat the same embedding\_model/embedding\_dimension on every request; one missed field re-introduces the above nondeterminism.

Adding a provider-level default makes the behavior deterministic, removes boiler-plate, and aligns vector\_io with other APIs that already support provider defaults.

## Quick question about embedding dimensions


But honestly, this feels redundant. Since each model has a fixed dimension (all-MiniLM-L6-v2 is always 384), why make users look this up and type it manually?

I'm thinking we should just auto-lookup the dimension from the model registry:

```
## REQUIRED: Custom model needs explicit dimension
```

Hi [@ashwinb](https://github.com/ashwinb) , per my understanding,

If a user omits embedding\_model when creating a vector store, the stack grabs ‚Äúthe first model in run.yaml‚Äù‚Äîthat can change between deployments, so identical API calls embed with different models/dimensions.

Teams must repeat the same embedding\_model/embedding\_dimension on every request; one missed field re-introduces the above nondeterminism.

Adding a provider-level default makes the behavior deterministic, removes boiler-plate, and aligns vector\_io with other APIs that already support provider defaults.

The plan should be updated to align with the provider-level approach discussed in the GitHub issue.
